descriptions: Fails to identify any key information on food labels.
Identifies only one or two pieces of key information (e.g., serving size or calories).
Identifies some key information but misses important details (e.g., total fat, sugar content).
Identifies most key information, with minor omissions or inaccuracies.
Accurately identifies all key information, including serving size, calories, macronutrients, and micronutrients.
Accurately and comprehensively identifies all key information and can explain the purpose of each element on the label.
Demonstrates no understanding of the nutritional content listed on food labels.
Shows minimal understanding of the nutritional content; struggles to differentiate between nutrients.
Understands basic nutritional content but struggles with more complex concepts (e.g., % Daily Value).
Demonstrates a good understanding of nutritional content and can interpret % Daily Value with some assistance.
Clearly understands nutritional content, including macronutrients, micronutrients, and % Daily Value.
Demonstrates a thorough understanding of nutritional content and can explain the impact of different nutrients on health.
Unable to apply information from food labels to make informed dietary choices.
Attempts to apply information but makes inaccurate or irrelevant connections to dietary choices.
Applies information to dietary choices with limited success; provides incomplete or unclear explanations.
Applies information to make reasonable dietary choices but lacks detailed reasoning.
Effectively applies information to make informed dietary choices and provides clear, logical reasoning.
Consistently applies information to make optimal dietary choices and provides insightful explanations of the rationale behind those choices.
